meanings.definition: Capable of being overcome or defeated.
meanings.sent1: The giant robot was defeatable by the brave knight.
meanings.sent2: The team knew the opponent was defeatable with proper strategy.
meanings.sent3: The dragon found it amusing that it was defeatable by a tiny mouse.
meanings.sent4: The fortress stood tall, seemingly undefeatable, until the invaders found a way to make it defeatable.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle was so tricky that it seemed defeatable only by the most skilled players.

meanings.definition: Able to be beaten or conquered.
meanings.sent1: The villain's evil plan was defeatable by the superhero's quick thinking.
meanings.sent2: The army was confident that the enemy was defeatable in the upcoming battle.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking parrot was amusing, but the thought of a defeatable one was even funnier.
meanings.sent4: The champion boxer seemed undefeatable until a new challenger emerged, proving even the strongest can be defeatable.
meanings.sent5: The virus was so powerful that it seemed defeatable only with the most advanced technology.
